name: Earthjustice
mission: Stay informed on how we hold accountable those who break our environmental laws.
programs: End the extraction and burning of fossil fuels
Secure clean air and water as rights for all
Remove toxic chemicals and products from our daily lives
Farm sustainably for healthy lives, lands, climate
theoryOfChange: Earthjustice has a published 'Commitment To Justice' framework. This framework, developed by their CJI team, outlines a clear vision for advancing justice in their work, conceiving an 'Ecosystem of Justice' that aims to achieve a truly democratic multi-racial society, incorporating and serving all people and the planet. It emphasizes that every staff member has the power and responsibility to advance justice in their interactions, choices, and work. Their approach involves critical inquiry to understand their impact internally and externally. Additionally, Earthjustice's 'Our Work' section details their goals, such as ending fossil fuel extraction, securing clean air and water, and building a justice-centered environmental movement, and describes their key strategies to achieve these, including using legal tools and partnering with communities.

score_details.score_summary: Earthjustice shows strong impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://earthjustice.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: Earthjustice focuses on environmental law programs and maintains specific financial metrics regarding working capital and program efficiency.
The organization reported total revenue of $125,960,142 and a program expense ratio of 80.2%.
Donors can support Earthjustice through various giving methods, which are considered sadaqah-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Earthjustice earns a 65/100 reflecting its robust financial health and high program spending, though its specialized advocacy model results in a higher cost per outcome compared to direct-service charities.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary due to the resource-intensive nature of long-term legal advocacy
Lower alignment with specific donor demographics seeking direct humanitarian service delivery

dimension_explanations.alignment: As an advocacy-focused organization, Earthjustice addresses urgent climate and health issues, though it maintains a low donor fit for those prioritizing traditional Muslim community causes [1]. The organization is recognized as sadaqah-eligible for donors interested in environmental justice [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high operational capacity, allocating 80.2% of its $125,960,142 revenue directly to its legal programs [2]. While its capacity-building model is effective for systemic change, the nature of environmental litigation results in a high cost per beneficiary of 118249.374 [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Earthjustice serves as a premier nonprofit public interest law firm dedicated to wielding the power of law to protect the environment and public health.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 80.2% ensuring the majority of funds support legal advocacy
Strong financial stability with 19.3 months of working capital available
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.12 to raise every $1
baseline_narrative.summary: Earthjustice operates as a legal advocate for the environment, focusing on programs such as The Wild and Healthy Communities to secure lasting protections for the planet [1]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $125,960,142 to support its litigation and advocacy efforts [2]. Supporters can contribute to these initiatives through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods, including monthly donations and legacy gifts [3].

all_citations.claim: Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Earthjustice earns a 65/100 reflecting its robust financial health and high program spending, though its specialized advocacy model results in a higher cost per outcome compared to direct-service charities.

areas_for_improvement.context: Due to the resource-intensive nature of long-term legal advocacy, the cost per beneficiary is exceptionally high compared to direct service charities.
As an environmental advocacy organization, it lacks specific alignment with traditional Muslim donor priorities like direct humanitarian relief.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets BBB standards for charity accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains substantial reserves to weather long legal battles.
risk_factors: Legal advocacy is inherently long-term and outcomes are not guaranteed.
Extremely high cost per statistical beneficiary compared to direct aid.
case_against.summary: The primary consideration for donors is the indirect nature of the impact.

known_gaps: Charity Navigator overall rating not available

alignment.explanation: The organization offers <cite id="7">sadaqah-eligible giving methods</cite> but focuses on environmental advocacy rather than direct humanitarian relief.
alignment.improvement: Add a dedicated page or clearly state whether donations align with specific faith-based giving principles.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Earthjustice due to its <cite id="6">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a robust governance structure featuring a <cite id="10">33-member independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could publish more detailed, independent evaluations of its litigation outcomes.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a strong <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 80.2%</cite> and highly efficient fundraising operations that cost just <cite id="4">$0.12 to raise every $1</cite>.
impact.improvement: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports partner organizations aligned with environmental advocacy goals.

rich_narrative.headline: Earthjustice serves as a premier nonprofit public interest law firm dedicated to wielding the power of law to protect the environment and public health.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support systemic environmental protection through the legal system and are comfortable with long-term, indirect impact.
donor_motivations: Desire to protect natural resources and public health
Belief in the power of the legal system to force systemic change
Preference for established, highly professionalized organizations
giving_considerations: Impact is measured in legal precedents and policy changes, not direct human relief
Litigation can take years to resolve
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to provide immediate, direct humanitarian aid or those looking to fulfill specific zakat obligations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks specific legal victories and policy outcomes, though these are difficult to quantify in terms of individual human beneficiaries.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Earthjustice uses legal action to force compliance with environmental laws, thereby protecting ecosystems and public health.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In legal advocacy, tracking case outcomes and policy shifts is essential to ensure that litigation strategies are effectively advancing the mission.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Environmental litigation is highly resource-intensive, and the organization can scale its impact by taking on more cases against well-funded opposition.
strategic_priorities: End the extraction and burning of fossil fuels
Secure clean air and water as rights for all

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 80.2%</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funding directly supports legal advocacy.
Earthjustice is highly effective at mobilizing resources, spending only <cite id="4">$0.12 to raise every $1</cite>.
The organization holds <cite id="8">19.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing crucial stability for multi-year environmental litigation.

strengths_deep_dive: Earthjustice demonstrates exceptional financial stewardship and operational stability, which is critical for an organization engaged in protracted legal battles. The organization's <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 80.2%</cite> outperforms the <cite id="11">peer median of 77.5%</cite>. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are highly optimized, requiring just <cite id="4">$0.12 to raise every $1</cite>. This financial efficiency is paired with strong long-term planning, evidenced by its <cite id="8">19.3 months of working capital</cite> and a steady <cite id="9">4.7% revenue CAGR</cite> over the past three years.
rich_narrative.summary: Earthjustice is a premier nonprofit public interest environmental law organization that wields the power of law to protect the environment and public health. <cite id="1">founded in 1971</cite>, the organization has spent decades litigating on behalf of the planet. In 2023, the organization generated <cite id="2">$125,960,142 in total revenue</cite> to support its extensive legal advocacy programs. Earthjustice maintains a strong focus on its mission, directing <cite id="3">79.9% of its expenses to programs</cite>. The organization is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending just <cite id="4">$0.12 to raise every $1</cite>. As a legal advocacy group, Earthjustice operates primarily in the United States but also engages in international work, providing <cite id="5">$466,600 in foreign grants</cite> to support global environmental initiatives. The organization holds a <cite id="6">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting its commitment to public accountability. Donors can support Earthjustice through various <cite id="7">sadaqah-eligible giving methods</cite>, knowing that the organization maintains <cite id="8">19.3 months of working capital</cite> to sustain long-term legal battles. Over the past three years, Earthjustice has demonstrated steady financial growth with a <cite id="9">4.7% revenue CAGR</cite>. Its legal teams focus on critical areas such as ending the extraction of fossil fuels, securing clean air and water, and building a justice-centered environmental movement. The organization's board consists of <cite id="10">33 independent members</cite>, ensuring robust governance oversight.
